item.title: React ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏÇ¨Ïù¥Îìú Î†åÎçîÎßÅ
item.description: SSR(Server Side Rendering)? Îßê Í∑∏ÎåÄÎ°ú ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏÇ¨Ïù¥Îìú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏùÄ ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÎ°ú Î∂ÄÌÑ∞ Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏùÑ ÌïòÍ≤†Îã§. ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏó∞ÏÇ∞ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ÏÑú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌïòÍ≥† ÌéòÏù¥ÏßÄÎ•º ÏùëÎãµ ÌïòÎäî Î∞©Î≤ïÏù¥ SSR SSRÏùò Í≤ΩÏö∞ÏóêÎäî View‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
SSR(Server Side Rendering)?

Îßê Í∑∏ÎåÄÎ°ú ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏÇ¨Ïù¥Îìú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏùÄ ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÎ°ú Î∂ÄÌÑ∞ Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏùÑ ÌïòÍ≤†Îã§.
ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏó∞ÏÇ∞ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ÏÑú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌïòÍ≥† ÌéòÏù¥ÏßÄÎ•º ÏùëÎãµ ÌïòÎäî Î∞©Î≤ïÏù¥ SSR
SSRÏùò Í≤ΩÏö∞ÏóêÎäî ViewÎ•º ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏóêÏÑú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌï¥ Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò§Í∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê, Ï≤´ Î°úÎî©Ïù¥ Îß§Ïö∞ ÏßßÎã§.
but Î¨ºÎ°† SSRÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ ÌÅ¥ÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ìä∏ÏóêÏÑú JS ÌååÏùºÏùÑ Î™®Îëê Îã§Ïö¥Î°úÎìúÌïòÍ≥† Ï†ÅÏö©ÌïòÍ∏∞
Ï†ÑÍπåÏßÄÎäî Í∞ÅÍ∞ÅÏùò Í∏∞Îä•Ïù¥ ÎèôÏûëÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÍ≤†ÏßÄÎßå

ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏùò ÏûÖÏû•ÏóêÏÑúÎäî Îß§Ïö∞ Îπ†Î•∏ ÏÜçÎèÑÎ°ú Î°úÎî©Ïù¥ ÎêòÏóàÎã§Í≥† ÎäêÎÇÄÎã§.!

SPA , CSR Î†åÎçîÎßÅ Î∞©Ïãù

ÌïúÎ≤àÎßå Î¶¨ÏÜåÏä§ Î°úÎî© ÌïòÍ≥† ÌïÑÏöîÌï† ÎïåÎßàÎã§Îßå ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏôÄ ÌÜµÏã†Ìï¥ÏÑú ÏÇ¨Ïö©
ÏöîÏ≤≠ÌïòÎ©¥ ÌïúÌéòÏù¥Îßå Î∂àÎ°úÏÑú Ïù¥ÎèôÏãúÏóê Í∏∞Ï°¥ÌéòÏù¥ÏßÄÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ïÌï¥ÏÑú Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌï¥Ï£ºÎäî Î∞©Ïãù

SSR Ïû•Ï†ê

SEO(Search Engine Optimization, Í≤ÄÏÉâ ÏóîÏßÑ ÏµúÏ†ÅÌôî)

React or Vue Í∞ôÏùÄ ÏûêÎ∞îÏä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏ ÎùºÏù¥Î∏åÎü¨Î¶¨Îäî ÏóîÏßÑ(ÏûêÎ∞îÏä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏ ÏóîÏßÑ) ÎèôÏûëÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏúºÎ©¥ Ï†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä X Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú HTMLÏóê Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º Îã¥Í≥† Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöî Ìï†Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©

SSR Îã®Ï†ê

  • ÌôîÎ©¥ Ïù¥ÎèôÏãú ÌôîÎ©¥ ÍπúÎπ°ÏûÑ(UX)

  • ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Ïóê Î≥µÏû°Ìï¥ÏßÑÎã§.

    • Î®ºÏ†Ä ÏÑúÎ≤Ñ ÏΩîÎìúÏóê ÏûàÏñ¥ÏÑúÎèÑ JSXÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù ÎπåÎìúÎÇò Î≥ÄÌôòÌïòÎäî Í≥ºÏ†ïÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöî

  • ÏÑ±Îä• ÏïÖÌôî

    • ÏÑúÎ≤Ñ Î†åÎçîÎßÅÏóê Îî∞Î•∏ Î∂ÄÌïò(ÏÑ±Îä•)

ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏÇ¨Ïù¥Îìú Î†åÎçîÎßÅ READY!!

  • ÌôòÍ≤Ω

    • typescript React
    • @loadable/component
    • react-router
    • react-dom/server

Server.tsx ÏÉùÏÑ±

import React from 'react'
import ReactDOMServer from 'react-dom/server'
import Koa, { Middleware } from 'koa'
import { StaticRouter } from 'react-router'
import { ChunkExtractor } from '@loadable/server'
import { ServerStyleSheet } from 'styled-components'
import path from 'path'
import App from './App'

const app = new Koa()
const clientStats = path.resolve('./build/loadable-stats.json')
const ssr: Middleware = async ctx => {
  const context = {}
  const extractor = new ChunkExtractor({ statsFile: clientStats })

  const jsx = extractor.collectChunks(
    <StaticRouter location={ctx.url} context={context}>
      <App />
    </StaticRouter>
  )
  const sheet = new ServerStyleSheet()
  const rendered = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(sheet.collectStyles(jsx))
  const scStyles = sheet.getStyleTags()
  const collected = {
    script: extractor.getScriptTags(),
    link: extractor.getLinkTags(),
    style: extractor.getScriptTags() + scStyles,
  }
  const page = createPage(rendered, collected)

  ctx.body = page
}
app.use(ssr)
app.listen(5000, () => {
  console.log('SSR server listening to http://localhost:5000')
})

webpack ÏÑ§Ï†ï

  1. config/paths.js ÏÑ§Ï†ï
// config after eject: we're in ./config/
module.exports = {
  dotenv: resolveApp('.env'),
  appPath: resolveApp('.'),
  appBuild: resolveApp('build'),
  appPublic: resolveApp('public'),
  appHtml: resolveApp('public/index.html'),
  appIndexJs: resolveModule(resolveApp, 'src/index'),
  appPackageJson: resolveApp('package.json'),
  appSrc: resolveApp('src'),
  ..
  ..
  ..
  servedPath: getServedPath(resolveApp('package.json')),  // Í∏∞Ï°¥Ïóê ÏûàÎçò ÎÇ¥Ïö©Îì§...

  //Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌïúÎã§.!!!
  ssrIndexJs: resolveApp('src/server'),
  ssrBuild: resolveApp('dist'),
};
  1. (config/webpack.config.server.js)
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');
const webpack = require('webpack');
const resolve = require('resolve');
const PnpWebpackPlugin = require('pnp-webpack-plugin');
const ModuleScopePlugin = require('react-dev-utils/ModuleScopePlugin');
const getCSSModuleLocalIdent = require('react-dev-utils/getCSSModuleLocalIdent');
const paths = require('./paths');
const getClientEnvironment = require('./env');
const ModuleNotFoundPlugin = require('react-dev-utils/ModuleNotFoundPlugin');
const ForkTsCheckerWebpackPlugin = require('fork-ts-checker-webpack-plugin');
const typescriptFormatter = require('react-dev-utils/typescriptFormatter');
const nodeExternals = require('webpack-node-externals');

...Î∂àÌïÑÏöî ÏÇ≠Ï†ú

// This is the production and development configuration.
// It is focused on developer experience, fast rebuilds, and a minimal bundle.
module.exports = function(webpackEnv) {
  const isEnvDevelopment = webpackEnv === 'development';
  const isEnvProduction = webpackEnv === 'production';
  ...ÏÉùÎûµ
  // path ÏÑ§Ï†ï
    return {
        entry: [paths.ssrIndexJs].filter(Boolean),
        target: 'node',
        externals: [nodeExternals()],
        output: {
        // The build folder.
        path: paths.ssrABuild,
        filename: 'server.js',
        chunkFilename: isEnvProduction
            ? 'static/js/[name].[chunkhash:8].chunk.js'
            : isEnvDevelopment && 'static/js/[name].chunk.js',
        },


  };
};

3.scripts/build.ssr ÌååÏùº ÏÑ§Ï†ï

// Do this as the first thing so that any code reading it knows the right env.
process.env.BABEL_ENV = 'production'
process.env.NODE_ENV = 'production'

// Makes the script crash on unhandled rejections instead of silently
// ignoring them. In the future, promise rejections that are not handled will
// terminate the Node.js process with a non-zero exit code.
process.on('unhandledRejection', err => {
  throw err
})

// Ensure environment variables are read.
require('../config/env')

const fs = require('fs-extra')
const webpack = require('webpack')
const configFactory = require('../config/webpack.config.server')
const paths = require('../config/paths')
const checkRequiredFiles = require('react-dev-utils/checkRequiredFiles')

// Warn and crash if required files are missing
if (!checkRequiredFiles([paths.appHtml, paths.appIndexJs])) {
  process.exit(1)
}

// Generate configuration
const config = configFactory('production')

// Create the production build and print the deployment instructions.
function build(previousFileSizes) {
  console.log('Creating an optimized production build...')
  fs.emptyDirSync(paths.ssrBuild)
  let compiler = webpack(config)
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    compiler.run((err, stats) => {
      console.log(stats.toString())
    })
  })
}

build()

Build:SSR

  1. package.json scripts ÏÑ†Ïñ∏
  "scripts": {
    "start": "node scripts/start.js",
    "build": "node scripts/build.js",
    "build:ssr": "node scripts/build.ssr.js",
    "test": "node scripts/test.js"
  },
  1. Build

yarn build:ssr

[console]

[output]

  1. server Ïã§Ìñâ node ./dist/server.js

ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÏÇ¨Ïù¥Îìú Ïó∞Îèô ÏôÑÎ£å!!!

  • next Ïì∞Î©¥ Í∞ÑÎã®ÌïòÎã§Í≥† Îì§ÏóàÎäîÎç∞ ÏïÑÏßÅ ÏïàÏç®Î≥¥ÏïòÎã§.
  • webpack moduleÏùÄ Î≠êÍ∞Ä Îì§Ïñ¥ÏûàÎäîÏßÄÎäî Ï∞∏Í≥† Ìï† ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏûàÎäîÎìØ Ïã∂Îã§

References


  • velopert Î∏îÎ°úÍ∑∏
  • https://serverless.com/
  • medium/ÏïÑÌïò ÌîÑÎ°†Ìä∏ Í∞úÎ∞úÍ∏∞(1) ‚Äî SPAÏôÄ SSRÏùò Ïû•Îã®Ï†ê Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Nuxt.js

item.title: Typescript React Hook Ï†ïÎ≥µÌïòÍ∏∞
item.description: Typescript React Hook Ï†ïÎ≥µÌïòÍ∏∞ 1. useState useState Îäî Í∞ÄÏû• Í∏∞Î≥∏Ï†ÅÏù∏ Hook ÏúºÎ°úÏÑú, Ìï®ÏàòÌòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑúÎèÑ Í∞ÄÎ≥ÄÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Í∞ÄÏßà Ïàò ÏûàÍ≤å ÎêúÎã§. Ìï®ÏàòÌòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑú ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Í¥ÄÎ¶¨Ìï¥ÏïºÌï†Îïå Ïù¥ ÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö© 1-‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Typescript React Hook Ï†ïÎ≥µÌïòÍ∏∞

1. useState

useState Îäî Í∞ÄÏû• Í∏∞Î≥∏Ï†ÅÏù∏ Hook ÏúºÎ°úÏÑú, Ìï®ÏàòÌòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑúÎèÑ Í∞ÄÎ≥ÄÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Í∞ÄÏßà Ïàò ÏûàÍ≤å ÎêúÎã§.
Ìï®ÏàòÌòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑú ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Í¥ÄÎ¶¨Ìï¥ÏïºÌï†Îïå Ïù¥ Hook(useState) ÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©

import * as React from 'react'

const { useState } = React
interface CounterProps {}

const Counter: React.SFC<CounterProps> = props => {
  const [value, setValue] = useState(0)
  return (
    <div>
      <p>
        ÌòÑÏû¨ Ïπ¥Ïö¥ÌÑ∞ Í∞íÏùÄ <b>{value}</b> ÏûÖÎãàÎã§.
      </p>
      <button onClick={() => setValue(value + 1)}>+1</button>
      <button onClick={() => setValue(value - 1)}>-1</button>
    </div>
  )
}

export default Counter

1-1 Îã§Ï§ë useState ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ï

Ïó¨Îü¨Í∞úÎ©¥ Ïó¨Îü¨Í∞ú ÏÑ†Ïñ∏Ìï¥ÏÑú ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ ÎêúÎã§.

import * as React from 'react'

const { useState } = React
interface InfoProps {}
const Info: React.SFC<InfoProps> = props => {
  const [name, setName] = useState('')
  const [nickname, setNickname] = useState('')
  const onChangeName = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    setName(e.target.value)
  }
  const onChangeNickname = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    setNickname(e.target.value)
  }
  return (
    <div>
      <div>
        <input value={name} onChange={onChangeName} />
        <input value={nickname} onChange={onChangeNickname} />
      </div>
      <div>
        <div>
          <b>Ïù¥Î¶Ñ:</b> {name}
        </div>
        <div>
          <b>ÎãâÎÑ§ÏûÑ: </b>
          {nickname}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default Info

2. useEffect

useEffect Îäî Î¶¨Ïï°Ìä∏ Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏Í∞Ä Î†åÎçîÎßÅ Îê† ÎïåÎßàÎã§ ÌäπÏ†ï ÏûëÏóÖÏùÑ ÏàòÌñâÌïòÎèÑÎ°ù ÏÑ§Ï†ï Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Hook ÏûÖÎãàÎã§. ÌÅ¥ÎûòÏä§Ìòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏Ïùò componentDidMount ÏôÄ componentDidUpdate Î•º Ìï©ÏπúÍ≤ÉÏù¥ÎùºÍ≥† ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÌïòÎ©¥ Îê†Í±∞ Í∞ôÎã§

(vueÏóê mounted & computed Îûë ÎπÑÏä∑ÌïòÎã§Í≥† Î≥¥Î©¥ Îê†Í±∞ Í∞ôÏïÑ)

2-1 useEffect Ï†ÅÏö©ÌïòÍ∏∞

import * as React from 'react';

const { useEffect, useState } = React;
interface InfoProps{}
const Info: React.SFC<InfoProps> = props => {
    const [name, setName] = useState('');
    const [nickname, setNickname] = useState('');
    useEffect(() => {  // ÎßàÏö¥Ìä∏ ÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑÎèÑ Ïã§Ìñâ ÌïòÎäî ÏÜåÏä§
        console.log('Î†åÎçîÎßÅ ÏôÑÎ£å ÌñàÎã§.');
        console.log({
            name, nickname
        })
    })
    const onChangeName = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
        setName(e.target.value);
    }
    const onChangeNickname = (e:React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
        setNickname(e.target.value);
    }
  return ...

export default Info;

2-2 ÎßàÏö¥Ìä∏ Îê†ÎïåÎßå Ïã§ÌñâÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂Îã§Î©¥

useEffect(() => {
  // ÎßàÏö¥Ìä∏ ÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑÎèÑ Ïã§Ìñâ ÌïòÎäî ÏÜåÏä§
  console.log('ÎßàÏö¥Ìä∏ ÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏùÑÎïåÎßå Ïã§ÌñâÌïúÎã§..')
  console.log({
    name,
    nickname,
  })
}, [name])

2-3 ÌäπÏ†ï ÏßÄÏ†ï Í∞íÏù¥ ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏ Îê†Îïå Ïã§Ìñâ

ÏïÑÎßàÎèÑ componentDidUpdate

 componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {
        if (prevProps.value !== this.props.value) {

        }
      }

hook ÏúºÎ°ú ÏûëÏÑ±Ïãú

useEffect(() => {
  console.log({
    name,
    nickname,
  })
}, [name])

2-4 cleanup

useEffect Î†åÎçîÎßÅ ÎêòÍ≥†ÎÇú ÏßÅÌõÑÎßàÎã§ Ïã§ÌñâÎêúÎã§, ÎëêÎ≤àÏß∏ ÌååÎùºÎØ∏ÌÑ∞ Î∞∞Ïó¥Ïóê Î¨¥ÏóáÏùÑ ÎÑ£ÎäêÎÉêÏóê Îî∞Îùº Ïã§ÌñâÎêòÎäî Ï°∞Í±¥Ïù¥ Îã¨ÎùºÏßëÎãàÎã§.

ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏Í∞Ä unmount Ï†ÑÏù¥ÎÇò, update ÎêòÍ∏∞ Ï†ÑÏóê Ïñ¥Îñ†Ìïú ÏûëÏóÖÏùÑ ÏàòÌñâÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂Îã§Î©¥ useEffect ÏóêÏÑú Îí∑Ï†ïÎ¶¨(cleanup) Ìï®ÏàòÎ•º Î∞òÌôòÌï¥Ï£ºÏñ¥Ïïº Ìï©ÎãàÎã§.

useEffect(() => {
  console.log()
  return (
    console.log('cleanup');
  )
})

3. useContext

import * as React from 'react'

// Ïù¥ Hook ÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ Ìï®ÏàòÌòï Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑú Context Î•º Î≥¥Îã§ Îçî ÏâΩÍ≤å ÏÇ¨Ïö© Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§.
const { createContext, useContext } = React
const ThemeContext = createContext('black')
interface ContextSampleProps {}

const ContextSample: React.SFC<ContextSampleProps> = props => {
  const theme = useContext(ThemeContext)
  const style = {
    width: '24px',
    height: '24px',
    background: theme,
  }
  return <div style={style} />
}

export default ContextSample

4. useReducer

useReducer Îäî useState Î≥¥Îã§ Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ÏóêÏÑú Îçî Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÏÉÅÌô©Ïóê Îî∞Îùº Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Îã§Î•∏ Í∞íÏúºÎ°ú ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏Ìï¥Ï£ºÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏùÑ Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî Hook

ReducerÎäî ÌòÑÏû¨ ÏÉÅÌÉúÏôÄ UpdateÎ•º ÏúÑÌï¥ÏÑú ÌïÑÏöîÌïú Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º mutationÏóê Îã¥ÏïÑÏÑú actions Í∞íÏóê Î≥ÄÌôîÎêú ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º Î∞òÌôòÌïòÎäî Ìï®Ïàò ÏÉàÎ°úÏö¥ ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º ÎßåÎì§ÎïåÎäî Î∂àÎ≥ÄÏÑ± ÏùÑ ÏßÄÏºúÏÑú ÏÇ¨Ïö©

Reducer Counter

import * as React from 'react'

const { useReducer } = React
interface CounterProps {}
interface Action {
  type: String;
}
function reducer(state: any, action: Action) {
  // action.type Ïóê Îî∞Îùº Îã§Î•∏ ÏûëÏóÖ ÏàòÌñâ
  switch (action.type) {
    case 'INCREMENT':
      return { value: state.value + 1 }
    case 'DECREMENT':
      return { value: state.value - 1 }
    default:
      return state
  }
}
const Counter: React.SFC<CounterProps> = props => {
  const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, { value: 0 })
  return (
    <div>
      <p>
        ÌòÑÏû¨ Ïπ¥Ïö¥ÌÑ∞ Í∞íÏùÄ <b>{state.value}</b> ÏûÖÎãàÎã§.
      </p>
      <button onClick={() => dispatch({ type: 'INCREMENT' })}>+1</button>
      <button onClick={() => dispatch({ type: 'DECREMENT' })}>-1</button>
    </div>
  )
}

export default Counter

useReducer ÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌñàÏùÑ ÎïåÏùò Í∞ÄÏû• Ïû•Ï†êÏùÄ Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏ Î°úÏßÅÏùÑ Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ Ïô∏Î∂ÄÎ°ú Í∫ºÎÇº Ïàò ÏûàÎã§

4-2 Input Í¥ÄÎ¶¨

import * as React from 'react'

const { useReducer } = React
interface InfoProps {}
interface Action {
  name: string;
  value: string;
}
function reducer(state: any, action: Action) {
  return {
    ...state,
    [action.name]: action.value,
  }
}
const Info: React.SFC<InfoProps> = props => {
  const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, {
    name: '',
    nickname: '',
  })
  const { name, nickname } = state
  const onChange = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    dispatch(e.target)
  }
  return (
    <div>
      <div>
        <input name="name" value={name} onChange={onChange} />
        <input name="nickname" value={nickname} onChange={onChange} />
      </div>
      <div>
        <div>
          <b>Ïù¥Î¶Ñ:</b> {name}
        </div>
        <div>
          <b>ÎãâÎÑ§ÏûÑ: </b>
          {nickname}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default Info

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Getting Started üòé 1. Create a Gatsby site. If you are not using , following Gatsby Getting Started 2. Start developing. 3. Add your content‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started üòé

1. Create a Gatsby site.

# create a new Gatsby site using the blog starter
$ npx gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

If you are not using npx, following Gatsby Getting Started

$ npm install -g gatsby-cli
$ gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

2. Start developing.

$ cd my-blog-starter/
$ npm start
# open localhost:8000

3. Add your content

You can write‚Ä¶

  • contents to blog in content/blog directory.
  • resume content/__about directory.

With markdown syntax and some meta data

Support script for creating new post

$ npm run post

4. Fix meta data

You can fix meta data of blog in /gatsby-meta-config.js file.

5. Publish with netlify

üí° if you want to deploy github pages, add following script to package.json

"scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r 'git@github.com:${your github id}/${github page name}.github.io.git'"
}

:memo: Write a post!

content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __about
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ blog
  • You can register your resume on the web. (in __about directory)
  • You can register your post. (in blog directory)

üßê Customize!

Gatsby config

/root
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ gatsby-browser.js // font, polyfill, onClientRender ...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ gatsby-config.js // Gatsby config
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ gatsby-meta-config.js // Template meta config
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ gatsby-node.js // Gatsby Node config

Structure

src
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components // Just component with styling
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ layout // home, post layout
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pages // routing except post: /(home), /about
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ code.scss
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dark-theme.scss
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ light-theme.scss
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ variables.scss
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ templates
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ blog-post.js
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ home.js

Style

You can customize color in src/styles directory.

src/styles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ code.scss
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dark-theme.scss
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ light-theme.scss
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ variables.scss

Welcome to gatsby-starter-bee! Happy blogging! üëª

item.title: Welcome Bee starter
item.description: Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog! 1. Support Three frontmatter title date category 2. Code highlighting With‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog!

1. Support Three frontmatter

---
title: 'Welcome Bee starter'
date: 2019-2-6 16:21:13
category: 'development'
---
  1. title
  2. date
  3. category

2. Code highlighting

  1. With Fira Code font
  2. Support highlighting with prism 2-1. Use inline highlighting
import React from 'react'

const TEMPLATE = 'gatsby-starter-bee'
class Foo extends React.Component {
  handleClick = val => {
    if (val === 'bar') {
      return 1
    } else if (val !== 'zoo') {
      return 2
    }
    console.log(`clicked`)
    return 3
  }

  render() {
    return <div>Welcome, Gatsby, ${TEMPLATE}</div>
  }
}

code

3. Support Markdown (h2)

  1. With Noto Sans font
  2. Support header anchoring

h3

h4

h5

quote!

bold italic

4. Support emoji üöÄ

Based on emojione üôè

5. Support light/dark mode

6. Support social sharing feature

  1. Twitter
  2. Facebook

Bonus, Buy me a coffee button

Set, buyMeACoffeeId of gatsby-meta-config.js

7. Comments feature

You can add comments feature by selecting one of them.

  • Disqus
  • utterances

8. Other features of this template

  1. You can add resume to /about
  2. Lazy rendering
  3. Scroll restoration
  4. Categorize posts
  5. Offline caching with service worker (based gatsby)
  6. Support GA(Google Analytics)

Let‚Äôs Start! Go
